p: B. neglecta olegum resins from Somalia were very similar to B. carterii with low total contents of KBAs (0.2–1.7 µg/mg) and AKBAs (0.03–0.14 µg/mg) and high proportions of the respective α-isomers, α-KBA (18.5–32.9%) and α-AKBA (15.9–18.4%). Considering the similar contents of further boswellic and lupeolic acids, the differentiation between B. neglecta and B. carterii species is hampered. Only the high contents of acetyl-lupeolic acid, acetyl-α-boswellic acid, and acetyl-β-boswellic acid in some B. carterii gum resins might serve as a reference point for differentiation [ 5].
